Description.Name: Preparing for Armageddon
Description.Details: A supply shuttle latches onto the Argo’s lower bay with a metallic clang. Its manifest is thin—just a single crate, labeled in Ghost Bear Watch encryptions. Inside: a handful of salvaged systems, replacement components, and a diagnostic slate with a single message burned into its welcome screen. “Commander, This is all I can spare. My forces are spent. If you’re reading this, then the end is near—one way or another. —Arelle” Darius grimaces as you lower the slate. “That’s not encouraging.” Moments later, Sumire calls out. “Commander. New hyperpulse signal. Extreme level of encryption... origin unknown. Looks like it’s for us.” The message plays. Mizuki Bekker appears in monochrome, standing in some dim, windblown corridor. Her voice is calm—too calm. “You’ve come far, but this is where it ends. You have no idea what you’re walking into. That machine. You can maybe stop it, but you can't stop the others.” She pauses, then leans forward, her eyes hard. “You will not survive what comes next.” The message cuts out. Yang growls. “Damn it. That didn’t sound like bluff.” Farah crosses her arms. “She’s nervous. You don’t send warnings if you’re not afraid.” Sumire shakes her head. “Too late now, either way. We’ve come too far.” Darius looks to you. “I agree, Commander. We have no choice but to finish what we started.”

Description.Details: [A new contract has appeared in the Command Center]
